description:
This crash occurred on a curve of a two-lane undivided roadway with a posted speed limit of
                        89 KMPH (55 MPH). The weather was clear and the roadway was dry and level. This crash occurred
                        on a weekend afternoon.


                        Vehicle #1, a red 2003 Buick Century, was traveling south on the two-lane undivided roadway
                        negotiating a curve to the right when it went over the left side double yellow lines into the
                        northbound lane. Vehicle #2, a white 1992 Nissan Sentra, was traveling north on the same roadway
                        negotiating the same curve. Vehicle #1 impacted the front left of Vehicle #2 with its front
                        left. Vehicle #1 spun counter-clockwise and came to rest facing north on the southbound
                        shoulder. Vehicle #2 spun counter-clockwise and came to rest on the northbound shoulder facing
                        south.


                        The Buick Century (Vehicle #1) was driven by a belted 58-year old female who was airlifted to a
                        trauma center and hospitalized due to left leg and abdominal injuries. She stated that she could
                        not remember the actual crash but does remember talking with her passenger and then waking up to
                        see dirt, a broken window and the airbag. The right front passenger in this vehicle was a
                        relative of the driver, a belted 80-year old male with a previous diagnosis of dementia. He was
                        transported to an area hospital. The driver of this vehicle takes several medications for
                        diabetes, high blood pressure, and depression. She also has been diagnosed with sleep apnea.
                        Possible side effects of these medications include drowsiness and lethargy. It should be noted
                        here that a witness described this driver as looking “like she fell asleep.” Vehicle 1 was towed
                        due to damage.


                        The Critical Pre-crash Event coded to Vehicle #1 was this vehicle traveling over the lane line
                        on the left side of the travel lane. The Critical Reason for the Critical Pre-crash Event was
                        coded as an unknown critical non-performance error. It was possible that the driver fell asleep
                        or that she passed out - medical records did not indicate a cause for the crash. Associated
                        factors coded to this driver include her previous medical conditions (sleep apnea, diabetes,
                        high blood pressure, depression), the prescription medications she had been taking, and her
                        conversation with her passenger prior to the crash.


                        The Nissan Sentra (Vehicle #2) was driven by a belted 30-year old male who was airlifted to an
                        area trauma center. There was a belted 27-year old female passenger in the right front seat who
                        was transported to an area hospital. The occupants of this vehicle were not available for
                        interviews and did not return messages. This vehicle was towed due to damage.


                        The Critical Pre-crash Event coded to Vehicle #2 was other vehicle encroachment from opposite
                        direction over left lane line. The Critical Reason for the Critical Pre-crash Event was not
                        coded to this vehicle. No associated factors could be coded to this driver due to the lack of an
                        interview.
